column3: Description
2017 article scrapes for Daily News (Tanzania).
Initiative that maps out the ways in which public data can be used to improve the way we understand how governments spend our money.
An encrypted platform that helps whistleblowers anonymously communicate with journalists / civic watchdogs.
Visualized map of Tanzanian health initiatives.
Shows how public budget data can be used to help citizens better understand how governments spend tax money
Simplifies budget and matters of public spending for citizens
An easy to use Android app for citizen journalists, to help them record video / photo / audio reports from the field.
An embeddable map that shows climate change projections
An Ushahidi based project that was used to map out crowd sourced information about the infrastructure damaged and missing people during the 2017 August Freetown Flash Floods
Africa's largest largest freely searchable collection of gazettes.
Enabling citizens to get to the ballot box informed and ready. Find your registration center and verify your details through web or SMS.
An open source tool for journalists and researchers who want to track networks of political or economic interest.
A suite of data-driven web and SMS-based tools that help citizens check everything from medicine prices and hospital services, to whether their doctor is a quack or not
Find the hospital closest to you with this tool.
HURUmap helps storytellers and campaigners use data to add context and depth to stories.
Platform designed to bring together data from different sectors to facilitate data driven decision making, policy formation, and reporting.
A web based portal that maps out the infrastructure facilities in the informal settlements in Freetown.
Are you paying your domestic worker enough? Use the living wage calculator to check if you are paying a livable wage in Tanzania.
Web App and SMS application that provides citizens with an opportunity to comment positively or negatively and offer solutions to the challenges facing public offices on service delivery.
Trust who's mission is to increase influence and representation of marginalized communities through the creative use of digital tools for action.
Are you paying too much for medicines? Med Prices Tanzania helps you determine how much you should be paying.
A web based portal that aims to improve the delivery of water and sanitation services in Freetown
Mzalendo (‘Patriot’ in Swahili) is a non-partisan project started in 2005 whose mission is to “keep an eye on the Kenyan parliament”.
We provide mobile technology solutions to solve some of the most pressing health issues.
Biggest collection of freely available gazettes in South Africa
Africa's largest independent repository of open data
Provides datasets on issues to do with African countries such as population, ecomony etc
Open Duka is a project designed by the Open Institute that will provide a freely accessible database of information on Kenyan entities
A community building laboratory information systems for resource-constrained international clinical and reference laboratories.
The global OpenMRS community works together to build the world's leading open source enterprise electronic medical record system platform
Outpatient is a simple patient registration application written in Ruby on Rails and is intended as a web front end for OpenMRS.
Library for processing payments using the Pesapal Gateway (not actively maintained).
An open data internet of things project that seeks to build low cost environment monitoring stations within the Kampala urban areas
Database of deleted tweets by Kenyan politicians
A grassroots radio project for community input and output
A suite of data-driven web and SMS-based tools that help citizens check everything from medicine prices and hospital services, to whether their doctor is a quack or not
Network of air quality monitoring sensors in Africa
An online platform that provides educational learning content for students and teachers in secondary schools.
A cross platform tool that aims to provide awareness and disseminate sensitization information regarding cholera in an interactive and intuitive manner Edit
Africa's largest repository of documentary evidence and other "actionable documents" from investigative journalists and civic watchdogs.
Android app used for citizen reporting of breaking news
The Taarifa Platform is an open source web API, designed to close citizen feedback loops.
The Taarifa Platform is an open source web API, designed to close citizen feedback loops.
TaxClock shows how public budget data can be used to help citizens better understand how governments spend our taxmoney.
Par­lia­ment Watch is a non-profit or­ga­ni­za­tion that mon­i­tors and re­ports on the work of the Par­lia­ment of Uganda.
Ushahidi, which translates to “testimony” in Swahili, was developed to map reports of violence in Kenya after the post-election violence in 2008.
Civic tech tool by is designed to track data related to the supply and consumption of drinking water in Nigeria
Wazimap, from the Xhosa word ulwazi for knowledge, is a joint project by Media Monitoring Africa and OpenUp that provides easy access to South African census and elections data.

All mining companies in Ghana are supposed to pay 3% of the revenues they generate back to local residents. Has your village received its fair share? You can check whether your community has received the funds due to it by simply selecting your location below.

YamaYama is designed to help Nigerians fight for a healthier environment. The platform helps citizens check whether garbage dumps in their neighbourhood are legal and -- if not -- helps citizens alert the authorities.
